title: Part-Time Loss Prevention Service Specialist
description:
The Loss Prevention Service Specialist will be placed in high risk/complex stores. The primary role of the LPSS is to engage customers, promote customer service and provide deterrence to theft. The LPSS will be highly visible and spend the majority of their time at the store entrance and in “Center Core”. The LPSS will work to raise shortage awareness among store associates. This position will communicate frequently with both store management and loss prevention associates.


Hourly rate based on experience, minimum starting rate of $16.00

**ACCOUNTABILITIES**


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

* Works to promote customer service in the store by implementing the Kohl's “Smile and Say Hi” initiatives and helping customers with their needs
* Assists in implementing loss prevention strategy
* Promote a neat and clean store appearance at the entrance
* Conducts associate package checks
* Works in “Center Core” or at entrances to deter theft and provide customer service


OTHER DUTIES

* Will NOT make shoplifting apprehensions
* May assist the loss prevention associates, as necessary
* Conducts building and physical security inspections to minimize exposure to loss
* Promotes a safe environment for associates and customers and responds to emergency situations

**QUALIFICATIONS**


REQUIRED

* Maintains attendance according to Kohl's standards
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Works well with fellow associates, supervisors and customers
* Maintains high ethical standards and adheres to Kohl's policies and procedures
* Maintains standards of appearance by following the required Kohl's dress code
* Ability to participate in physical activities, including walking, lifting and climbing on a regular basis


PREFERRED

* Experience in a customer service environment
* Prior experience in retail loss prevention, security or law enforcement preferred

  

Pay Range: $16.00 - $23.10  

Kohl’s offers a variety of benefits to associates depending on full-time/part-time status and work hours, including: WORK LIFE BALANCE (PTO, Vacation Buy Program, Parental Leave), HEALTH & WELLNESS (Medical, Dental, Vision and other short and long term disability programs, Emergency health and wellness programs such as Accident Protection Plans, Critical Illness Plans and more), SAVINGS & RETIREMENT BENEFITS (401k, Flexible Spending Accounts and associate discount programs with Kohl’s partners), INSURANCE PROGRAMS (Life Insurance for you, your family or your pet, as well as other protection programs), and LIFE EVENTS (Legal and adoption assistance benefits).
company_description: Kohl’s is a leading omnichannel retailer with more than 1,100 stores in 49 states.

title: Annuities Inbound Sales Consultant
description:
Job Classification:
Sales - Sales
At Prudential, we believe talent is key to achieving our vision. When you join Prudential, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions!
Prudential Annuities, a division within Prudential’s Individual Retirement Strategies Group, is currently seeking a sales professional to join its growing team as an Inbound Sales Consultant. In this role, you will work on a vibrant team of 20-25 customer-focused individuals. In this fast-paced, constantly changing role, you will help financial professionals solve their day-to-day problems and get the most out of their business relationships with Prudential.
Prudential's Annuities Business is gaining global recognition! Learn more about our business and accomplishment here:
https://pru.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers/page/2bf035ee7a4610011182807a60910004
The current Employee Work Arrangement for this opening is Hybrid. The employee will work 1-2 days a week at a Prudential location in Newark, NJ, Dresher, PA, or Shelton, CT. Employee will be required to attend or go into the office for any mandatory onsite/offsite meetings/trainings. Employee Work Arrangement is the businesses decision and can be adjusted or changed for business reasons at any time.
What you can expect:* Field daily phone calls, respond to emails, and routinely solve financial advisor needs as they arise.
* Deliver detailed responses to inquiries about Prudential product features, performance data, hypothetical illustrations, and requests for literature.
* Provide back-up coverage to Internal Wholesalers and their territories as needed.
* Reactively engage existing or prospective financial professionals in creative opportunities daily, using consultative selling techniques and by continuously educating about Prudential solutions.
* Receive immediate training, as well as ongoing coaching and mentoring from experienced members of the sales team in order to equip yourself with the meaningful sales and leadership skills necessary for success in this role.
* Focus on personal talent advancement to prepare for opportunities to become an Internal Wholesaler.


What you’ll need:* SIE, FINRA Series 6 (or 7) and 63 REQUIRED
* If not currently licensed, see Annuities Sales Associate position
* Ability to pass State Insurance license within 60 days
* Prior Sales experience, preferably with Annuities
* Knowledge of Annuities concepts or the retirement industry


It’d be a plus if you had:* Self-motivated and team-focused
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Flexibility, resourcefulness, tactfulness, and a desire to continuously improve
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience


Prudential welcomes all applicants, even if you don't meet every requirement. If your skills align with the role, we encourage you to apply.
At Prudential, you can:
Take charge of your career. People who have successfully developed their skills in this role have gone on to be promoted to an Internal Wholesaler which can lead to a potential career in wholesaling, operations, leadership, and product roles.
We equip and empower our employees to expand their skills and experience by using powerful learning, gigs, and job opportunities. We offer a suite of services including 1:1 Career advice, on demand resources and networking to propel your career forward.
We’re a global organization, full of outstandingly dedicated people who aren’t afraid to think differently, challenge the status quo and take sensible risks along the way. You will enjoy pushing boundaries as we build innovative technology that helps clients, customers and employees live their best lives. You will have access to leadership and learning opportunities and the resources needed to take your career in any direction. We will help you do your best work, offering flexibility, while delivering on our Purpose.
What we offer you:* Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave
* Retirement plans:
* 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%)
* Company-funded pension plan
* Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Shares can be purchased at 85% of the lower of two prices (Beginning or End of the purchase period), after one year of service.


To find out more about our Total Reward package, see our Total Rewards Brochure. Some of the above benefits may not apply to part-time employees scheduled to work less than 20 hours per week.
Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $57,900.00 to $86,100.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. In addition, employees are eligible for standard benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and retirement.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.
Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.
The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ and its affiliates.
Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. Search firms or agencies should email Staffing at staffingagencies@prudential.com for more information about doing business with Prudential.
PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES:  

If you need an accommodation to complete the application process, which may include an assessment, please email accommodations.hw@prudential.com.
Please note that the above email is solely for individuals with disabilities requesting an accommodation. If you are experiencing a technical issue with your application or an assessment, please email careers.technicalsupport@prudential.com to request assistance.

title: Floral Studio Assistant
description:
For over three decades, ÉLAN FLOWERS has served as an inspired standard in an ever-changing floral industry. As an established design house with long standing relationships, our bespoke retail, event, and private/corporate subscription services communicate to the personal taste and vision of each of our clients, with élan: energy, style and panaché!

Equal parts quality and integrity, we pride ourselves in using the freshest flowers that speak directly to the season, while keeping our design consistent to ÉLAN FLOWERS classic aesthetic with a contemporary twist. Our floral studio in TiBeCa also serves as a beautifully curated retail boutique, which allows for a truly delightful experience for the senses, that we hope to share with you.

Who you are:

* Highly organized, energetic, a multi-tasker and detail oriented
* Able to take direction and accept feedback, observe daily flow and proactively improve it
* Flexible, maintain a positive attitude, quick learner
* A strong team player; able and willing to contribute to meet sales goals

Duties include the following, exact tasks will vary daily depending on business needs:

STORE SET-UP + CHOP & DROP

* Process wholesale deliveries into buckets for designers. Learn names of flowers and treat each differently and properly
* Assist designers to change the water of display flowers each morning before displaying and help to set up the front of the store
* Assist designers to rotate older display flowers to the back to be used by designers, and put fresh flowers out front to develop
* Prep arrangements for event delivery
* Keep the design studio clean plus sweeping and handling trash

DELIVERY ASSISTANCE

* Provide excellent customer service and build customer loyalty by delivering flower arrangements in a timely, cordial manner
* Ensure orders are delivered accurately and in good condition
* Communicate any issues or delays and resolve problems efficiently
* Represent the company with excellence and professionalism while exercising discretion and good judgement by treating clients, recipients, venues, and vendors with respect
* Setting up flowers onsite for our corporate/personal Accounts and Events
* Share feedback & opinions respectfully & considerately with team

THROUGHOUT DAY

* Restock and maintain supplies, tools, and cleanliness of the design studio and retail area:
* *Unpack, de-sticker and stock Vases*
* *Prep Gift Wraps*
* Occasional local, walking deliveries
* Watering outdoor plants

COOLER MAINTENANCE

* Keep buckets and vases of water in the cooler clean; at least twice a week
* Sweep and mop

BEFORE END OF DAY

* Assist other staff with emptying and bagging trash into designated containers, collapse and bind cardboard for recycling, set both out for pickup
* Remove empty buckets and consolidate at the end of each day

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

* Must be available Saturdays and expanded Holiday hours; time off black out dates include:
* *First 2 weeks of February*
* *First 2 weeks of May*
* *2 weeks beginning Labor Day*
* Flexible schedule required - must be available for evening and weekend events as needed
* Must be available Saturdays

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* Day shift
* Morning shift

Experience:

* flower shop: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Representative
description:
We are looking for a Sales Representative who will be responsible for building relationships and developing referral opportunities with businesses (hospitals, rehabs, facilities), professionals (GCMs, Discharge Planners, Care Navigators), community organizations (senior centers, government agencies), and individuals serving the elderly community. The sales representative will be required to travel to Mass, NY, New Hampshire, and CT. This individual must gain a comprehensive and deep understanding of the professional and consumer community in order to both increase the referral of qualified clients to the company as well as identify resources with which the company can partner to provide optimum client service and care.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Analyze target Markets and develop sales leads and materials.
* Increase referral source volume through daily interactions with healthcare professionals and organizations.
* Develop strong relationships with community and professional organizations to create a consistent network that generates the necessary inquiries and admissions. Establish relationships and marketing opportunities with community groups, healthcare organizations, and industry associations.
* Develop weekly/monthly schedule for determining frequency of visits to each referral source.
* Seeks out new business opportunities, such as partnerships with healthcare providers or expansion into new service areas, to enhance company growth and position within the homecare industry. Make phone calls or send emails to contact prospective customers.
* Leverage your knowledge of homecare as a senior care expert to referral sources by Educating consumers on agency services.
* Handle payments and close transactions, Make presentations to professionals and community organizations on the homecare industry as a whole.
* Determine company information and presentation methods with providers based on each provider's needs/interests and professional goals.
* Create and maintain a database of all contacts and referral sources, present weekly status reports of all site visits, and follow up leads on perspective referrals and other activities.
* Participates in on-call
* Determine incentives and promotional items to ensure stand-out recognition within the homecare industry.
* Determine industry or competitor trends, such as rates, services, etc., to determine whether the company should renew or change its professional image or edge.
* Present to professionals and community organizations on the homecare industry as a whole.
* Perform any other activities as directed by the supervisor.

**Must Haves:**

* Minimum of five year’s Outside sales or liaison experience in the health care industry.
* Experience working with various health care partners and an understanding of the overall health care industry.
* Account management style sales experience.
* Prior experience calling on hospital social workers/case managers.
* Self-driven approach and personal accountability.
* Track record of team collaboration
* Solid community and professional contacts within the geographic market
* Record of superior customer service in a high-end service business
* Enthusiastic, positive thinking, and effective communicator
* Proven record of effectiveness in relationship-development sales
* Strong computer skills
* Valid Driver’s License
* Degree in Marketing
* Experience in private pay Home Care sales.
* Proven track record of meeting with patients/families and achieving sales goals.

Competitive Benefits Package. Commission/Incentive Program.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Company car
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 100% (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: RN Clinical Supervisor- Home Care
description:
All Metro Health Care, a Modivcare Personal Care Service, is looking for a Clinical Supervisor. You will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of our clients and foster the professional growth of our home health aides.
  
  

* Pay: $74,880 to $95,000 based on experience
* Sign-on Bonus: $3,000
* Schedule: M-F 8:30AM-5:00PM

* Office: 5225 Nesconset Highway, Building 6, Suites 30-32, Port Jefferson, NY 11776


Benefits and Perks…
  
  

* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* 401(k) with a 6% match
* Paid Time Off
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Discounts (retail, hotel, food, restaurants, car rental, and much more!)

You will...

* Assists physician in developing a plan of treatment/care and makes necessary revisions based upon patient's condition/needs.

We are excited to speak to someone with the following…

We live and lead by our Values…

title: Union Warehouse Associate - 2nd Shift
description:
**Job Description:**

Since 1953, Ferguson has been a source of quality supplies for a variety of industries. Together We Build Better infrastructure, better homes and better businesses. We exist to make our customers’ complex projects simple, successful, and sustainable. We proactively solve problems, adapt and grow to continuously serve our customers, communities and each other. Ferguson is proud to provide best-in-class products, service and capabilities across the following industries: Commercial/Mechanical, Facilities Supply, Fire and Fabrication, HVAC, Industrial, Residential Trade, Residential Building and Remodel, Waterworks and Residential Digital Commerce. Ferguson has approximately 36,000 associates across 1,700 locations. Ferguson is a community of proud associates who operate with the shared purpose of building something meaningful. You will build a career that you are proud of, at a company you can believe in.


Ferguson is currently seeking a Union Warehouse Associate to join our team!

**The pay rate for this role is $18 hourly and the schedule is Monday-Friday 11:30am-8pm**

**Responsibilities:**

* Safely operate a stand-up forklift (order selector/cherry picker) to pull and prepare outbound customer orders.
* Build, wrap, sort, and transport pallets and packages.
* Use technology like RF devices to sort, scan, and prepare orders.
* Accurately and timely receive, verify, stage and stock all incoming material.
* Clean the workspace as you go and participate with the team in keeping our facility clean, safe, and accident free.

* High school diploma/GED or equivalent education.

title: Afterschool ABA Behavior Technician / DSP Passaic (N)
description:
Sunshine Advantage is hiring in various locations in Passaic county. Locations Hiring are Clifton, Ringwood, Paterson, and Passaic.

**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.

**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**

Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location

Online and on the job training

Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career

to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)

Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA

Referral Bonus

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.

Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.

Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.

Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.

Collect accurate data daily.

Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.

Attends staff meetings and training as requested.

Completes additional job duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

High School Diploma, GED

Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism

Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.

Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization

Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years

Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.

Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.

Background Clearance is mandatory.

Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

title: Residential Manager (4-Bed IRA ) Rego Park (Queens)
description:
**We are looking for a Residence Manager for our 4-BED IRA in Rego Park, Queens, NY!**

**Excellent Benefits, Flexible Hours & Opportunities for Professional Growth!**

ANIBIC, Inc. provides services to people with Intellectual Disabilities. Our goal is to optimize independence and the quality of life for those we serve!

**The Manager's Job Responsibilities include (but are not limited to) the following:**

* Proactively manage the day-to-day operations and initiate corrective actions to ensure operational efficiencies and quality care.
* Complete, maintain and submit accurate records and reports (ie. payroll, incident reports, financial ledgers, performance data regarding participants, meeting minutes, etc.)
* Ensure compliance with OPWDD regulations and initiate corrective actions as needed.
* Coach, mentor, train, evaluate and supervise Direct Support Professionals (DSP)
* Serve as the Interdisciplinary Team Leader and participate in all necessary program-planning meetings.
* Ensure the IRA is maintained and presents a safe and home-like environment
* Role-model and perform all aspects of participant’s program plans and demonstrate techniques to residence staff.
* Coordinate community inclusion and recreational plans.
* Professionally represent the organization when interacting with all internal and external stakeholders (ie. employees, participant families, vocational programs, etc.) with a positive customer-service orientation.
* Ensure adequate staffing and scheduling.
* Successfully complete and ensure that all staff receive required trainings e.g. AMAP, CPR, First Aid, etc.
* Plan, organize, facilitate and oversee individual programming and community inclusion activities.
* Support management and nursing staff in ensuring operational efficiency and quality care.

**This opportunity is PERFECT for someone who:**

* Has management / leadership experience serving people with disabilities *AND who would prefer a smaller span of control (this is a 4-Bed IRA serving highly - independent individuals!).*
* Has experience as a Direct Support Professional and who wants to gain valuable management and leadership experience.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to climb and descend interior and exterior stairs and ambulate up and down exterior fire escapes.
* Must have the ability to board/de-board agency vehicles and public transportation vehicles (bus/subway).

**Necessary Qualifications:**

* **Must possess a valid driver's Liscence** (Driving the ANIBIC mini-van is required for appointments and leisure activities).
* Must have experience providing services to people with Intellectual Disabilities
* Must have knowledge and experience working within OPWDD regulations

**Preferred** ***(Not Necessary)*** **Qualifications:**

* An Associate's / Bachelor's Degree (preferably in human services, psychology or other related field)
* Supervisory / leadership experience while serving people with Intellectual Disabilities

**ANIBIC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, familial status, military status, disability and any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignments, benefits, layoff, and termination.**

title: Warehouse Associate/Driver
description:
Join the kingdom! By raising the standard, we turn the ordinary into the extraordinary!
  
  

With over 30+ years in the production industry, Drape Kings has cemented itself as the premier event services provider! We are excited to bring together the best team in the business to help continue our mission of Raising the Standard in the Special Events Industry!
  
  

As a Warehouse Associate, you will play a crucial role in the efficiency of our warehouse operations. You will be responsible for picking and packing orders, assist with loading/unloading, managing returned merchandise, and last minute drop offs. This role demands physical strength, attention to detail, and the ability to handle multiple tasks effectively. You will also act as the emergency Stagehand driver for last minute pick up and drop offs.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Warehouse Operations:
* Perform pick and pack duties with accuracy and efficiency.
* Lift up to 75 lbs, load and unload goods, and operate pallet jacks.
* Prepare orders for jobs, including packing and labeling.
* Receive and check-in returned merchandise, inspecting goods for damage.
* Sort materials and place them on racks, shelves, or bins according to their destination.
* Demonstrate flexibility to work on multiple projects concurrently.
* Maintain a commitment to excellence and high standards.
* Drop off/Pick up Duties:
* Drive and drop off/pick up equipment using company vans, 16' and 24' straight trucks.
* Experience with city driving is required; safe driving practices are essential.
* Ensure safe and timely drop off/pickups of products to various locations.


**Qualifications:**  

We hire people, not resumes. But we also expect excellence, which is why we require:
  
  

•
  
  

* High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or 3 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Valid driver's license a MUST.
* Valid DOT card required, or willing to get DOT card when hired.
* Experience driving vans, 16' and 24' straight trucks.
* Ability to speak English, read, and interpret documents such as packing lists, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) is a plus.
* Experience in events a plus.
* Background in theatrical, AV, event decor, lighting, and/or sound is preferred.
* Ability to understand and adhere to safety requirements and precautions.
* Capability to perform the physical labor necessary, including lifting and carrying items over 75 pounds.
* Commitment to maintaining high standards of work.


**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**  

* Occasional lifting, pushing, and carrying of items more than 75 pounds.
* Ability to work in a warehouse environment.
* Flexibility to adapt to different tasks and work conditions as required.


**Why Work for Drape Kings:**  

You are creative and enjoy fast paced environments. You are seeking a company where you can be heard, and bring your creativity to life through the work that you do. You are customer centric and thrive in an entrepreneurial and collaborative environment. You love to work with a client roster of exceptional companies and brands. We offer excellent benefits including 401k with company matching.
  
  

**What we Offer:**  

* Competitive Pay
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* 401K w/ Company match
* Company sponsored Life Insurance
* Generous paid time off
* 6 Paid holidays and 2 floating holidays
* Employee Discounts


 
  
  

**About:**  

Drape Kings is a nationwide event services specializing in rental and manufacturing of pipe and drape equipment, as well as AV-Drop Modular Backdrop Systems, primarily for live events. Along with full-service installation, other theatricals include Kabuki Reveals, traveler tracks, Step and Repeats, event carpet, and many related scenic elements.
  
  

With the core business in the event pipe and drape arena, projects can range from basic drape masking to revealing a building facade. The more recent addition of the globally accepted AV-Drop System allows Drape Kings to offer complete event solutions. If you are looking outside of the box for a company that provides essential components for event environments, look no further. That's what we do. From a new product announcement to large entertainment productions, event, drape is more than likely part of the package. As we like to say, if it's happening, we're there.
  
  

**Equal Opportunity:**  

It is the policy of Drape Kings to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status regarding public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Drape Kings will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Outreach Health Educator
description:
The Bedford-Stuyvesant Family Health Center (BSFHC) is a patient-centered, team based multi-specialty practice in central Brooklyn. BSFHC has been providing affordable, comprehensive, outpatient medical and dental services in an outpatient setting for over 40 years. As a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), BSFHC serves all of the primary health care needs of families in the heart of North and Central Brooklyn. Our mission is to provide the most professional, courteous and highest quality health care, with dignity, to those we serve, especially the undeserved population, without regard for ability to pay.
  
  

We are seeking an Outreach Health Educator to join our Access Health Initiative (AHI). Incumbent aims to increase awareness in community about health-related issues to improve health decisions through education. The Outreach Health Educator will be providing health education to clients on available program services, health maintenance, and how barriers of adherence can be addressed to improve client's quality of care in collaboration with the client's care team.
  
  

Required field about 75% of the time and take mass transit to travel throughout New York City.
  
  

**Grant-funded:** Contingent upon continuation of grant funding from year to year.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities to include but not limited to:**  

* Develop partnerships at the community-level to identify individuals who are underserved, uninsured, out-of-care, especially people living with HIV (PLWH) as well as those in need of access to behavioral health and chronic disease management.
* Conduct outreach activities at various community organizations and healthcare settings to raise awareness on insurance coverage and health-related issues providing information on services offered by BSFHC through supporting programs.
* Educate clients on program services and patient medication management strategies.
* Engage other community-based organizations, both HIV-specific and non-HIV-specific, to develop and maintain an outreach database.
* Perform outreach to clients who have lost contact or require follow up on medical appointments through various communication methods (i.e., phone calls, letters, email).
* Conduct outreach presentations at events such as conferences and healthcare settings throughout the Brooklyn region.
* Document interventions and follow up client engagement in appropriate system (s) or administrative tracking tools for clients for data collection purposes and submission for accurate reports.
* Utilize social marketing tools and collaborate with partners to identify and contact hard-to-reach populations who are underserved and uninsured.
* Support the PrEP, HIV & HEP C programs by referring partners and community to accessing prevention services, particularly among MSM of color.
* Perform additional duties as requested by the Supervisor.


**Education/Experience Required:**  

* Bachelor's degree required or enrolled in college. Master's degree in health-related field such as nursing, social work, psychology, counseling, public health or public administration preferred.
* Experience working in HIV/AIDS, LGBTQ, and communities of color.
* Experience delivering community health information to vulnerable populations in Brooklyn and other jurisdictions.


**Other Related Skills/Experience:**  

Successful applicants should be able to describe their previous experience in reaching underserved and hard-to-reach populations, and connecting individuals to appropriate services. They should have a demonstrated ability to work independently, and document all work performed. The suitable candidate should have an understanding of the community's cultures and ethnicities, and knowledge of community assets and resources necessary to effectively respond to needs and gaps in service delivery. Have an ability to prioritize goals and objectives to deliver critical mission-driven services in a timely manner. Have a sensitivity to the needs and situations of a multi-cultural population with a variety of income levels. Have knowledge of Brooklyn-based systems of care. Have the ability to work effectively with a variety of people, and work in a team environment.
  
  

**Annual Salary:** $50,000

title: Case Manager - Bilingual Spanish - HIV Prevention/PrEP
description:
The Bedford-Stuyvesant Family Health Center (BSFHC) is a patient-centered, team based multi-specialty practice in central Brooklyn. BSFHC has been providing affordable, comprehensive, outpatient medical and dental services in an outpatient setting for over 40 years. As a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), BSFHC serves all of the primary health care needs of families in the heart of North and Central Brooklyn. Our mission is to provide the most professional, courteous and highest quality health care, with dignity, to those we serve, especially the undeserved population, without regard for ability to pay.
  
  

This position joins the HIV Prevention Team to support activities to promote and improve the health for people at risk of HIV/AIDS in addition to people with HIV in the wider community. Case Managers will work on a project-specific basis to reach and engage the uninsured or out-of-care, especially immigrants and other hard-to-reach populations, as well as those in need of access to PrEP, HIV care, behavioral health, chronic disease management and referrals for services in the community. It is critical that Case Managers have the required level of skills and expertise to work independently to develop effective strategies for adherence counselling, support the management of high viral loads and improve retention rates among patients.
  
  

As a Case Manager on the HIV Prevention team, you will be responsible for patients along the status neutral continuum. A typical case management caseload will include PrEP, HIV and Hep C caseloads. About 25% of HIV patients are coinfected with Hepatitis C, which makes it essential to understand the biology, treatment and support services required to effectively support these patients.
  
  

**Grant-funded:** Contingent upon continuation of grant funding from year to year
  
Required fieldwork about 75% of the time and take mass transit to travel throughout New York City.
  
  

**Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to:**  

**Case Management responsibilities:**  

* Maintain a caseload that provides comprehensive service delivery to all patients.
* Provide coordination and monitoring of all patients on PrEP for medical treatment and medication accessibility.
* Provides coordination and monitoring of HIV/AIDS medical treatment.
* Conduct rapid HIV testing to all persons (internally and in community settings) who are interested in PrEP and perform risk assessments for everyone who expresses a need to start taking PrEP as a medication to prevent HIV.
* Conducts patient intakes, assessments, reassessment, and develops and monitor service plans activities.
* Develops and monitors individualized patient care plans.
* Participates in patient case conference, taking detail notes to include in the EMR system.
* Conducts treatment adherence work with patients and follows up with patients' appointments to include making appointments for patients.
* Update PrEP Database and Excel spreadsheet daily and as per needed based on PrEP Visits.
* Conduct patient education sessions/risk assessment for patients who have been diagnosed with STIs (syphilis, chlamydia, trichomoniasis, Mpox, gonorrhea, HPV).
* Experience entering clients' data into AIRS and other database systems.
* Support the quality improvement activities, meeting and webinar.
* Provides weekly report of encounters to Data Manager.
* Complete all assessments, service planning and participate in case conferences with both internal and external stakeholders.
* Work with colleagues and Community Support Liaisons to retain patients into care.
* Optimize enabling services for patients and make appropriate referrals as needed.
* Complete the palliative care screens for patients and other EMR/AIRS ticklers as needed.
* Monitor clients in both the RAP and MCM Programs and work with Peer Navigators to empower clients lost to care.
* Timely update of AIRS with relevant data including indicator ticklers.
* Contribute and participate in case huddles, and case conferences, with appropriate level of documentation.
* Work to organize the CAB meetings in collaboration with CAB president and other members designated by the CAB.
* Collaborate and work alongside medical care teams to provide the most effective care strategies and treatment.
* Submit timely and completed reports that reflect the nature of your work activities.
* Contribute to QI activities and QI meetings to ensure the highest level of patient engagement and viral suppression rates.
* Work with supervisor on any other duties that may be assigned.


**Outreach activities responsibilities:**  

* Market the services of the Center to patients and families with the intention to reaching people who are not engaged in care.
* outreach-based marketing strategies and implementation plans to help the agency engage community residents in Bed-Stuy and Bushwick
* Assist to develop strategies for reaching local populations who are most-at-risk for contracting HIV/AIDS,
* Conduct HIV prevention-based presentations in the community as needed.
* Represent and attend external QI meetings as directed by supervisor.


**Service Delivery Site:**  

* Provide services to any designated service delivery site.


**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in public health, public administration, social work, psychology, biology or a related field
* Fully Bilingual (Spanish/English)
* Experience conducting community outreach
* Ability to work in an affirming, fast-paced, high-energy environment
* High level of accountability and initiative; needs to be a self-starter and value teamwork that supports the organization's growth.


Bi-lingual Spanish Speaking Candidates Preferred
  
  

**Salary Range:** $ 50,000 and based on experience
  
  

**Benefits Overview:** We offer attractive compensation with comprehensive benefits including: Medical, 401k Retirement Plan with discretionary Match, Free Life Insurance and Long-Term Disability, Transportation Plan, Generous Paid Vacations and Holidays.
  
  

BSFHC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

title: Hepatitis C Patient Navigator
description:
The Bedford-Stuyvesant Family Health Center (BSFHC) is a patient-centered, team based multi-specialty practice in central Brooklyn. BSFHC has been providing affordable, comprehensive, outpatient medical and dental services in an outpatient setting for over 40 years. As a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), BSFHC serves all of the primary health care needs of families in the heart of North and Central Brooklyn. Our mission is to provide the most professional, courteous and highest quality health care, with dignity, to those we serve, especially the undeserved population, without regard for ability to pay.
  
  

We are seeking HIV and Hepatitis C Patient Navigator. The Patient Navigator role is crucial in ensuring that patients receive seamless, comprehensive care by guiding them through the healthcare system and connecting them with the necessary services and resources. The Patient Navigator will work closely with clients, healthcare providers, and community organizations to improve healthcare access, particularly for underserved populations, including people living with Hepatitis C and HIV and those requiring behavioral health and chronic disease management services.
  
  

**Grant-funded:** Contingent upon continuation of grant funding from year to year.
  
  

**Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to:**  

* Serve as a primary point of contact for Hep-C patients, guiding them through the healthcare system and ensuring they access the services they need.
* Assist patients in understanding their diagnosis, treatment options, and care plans, and help them make informed decisions.
* Coordinate appointments, follow-ups, and referrals for patients, ensuring timely access to care and services.
* Provide support for patients in overcoming barriers to care, including transportation, insurance issues, and language barriers.
* Collaborate with healthcare providers, social workers, and community organizations to create and implement comprehensive care plans for patients.
* Conduct outreach to identify and engage underserved and out-of-care individuals, especially PLWH, and connect them to healthcare services.
* Assist patients in enrolling in insurance programs and other financial assistance programs to help cover the costs of their care.
* Maintain detailed records of patient interactions, care plans, and progress, ensuring accurate data collection and reporting.
* Educate patients on health maintenance, medication adherence, and chronic disease management.
* Participate in community outreach activities, including health fairs and educational workshops, to promote awareness of available healthcare services.
* Support the implementation of BSFHC's Access Health Initiative by connecting community members to services and resources.
* Perform additional duties as requested by the Supervisor.


**Education Required:**  

Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Social Work, Public Health, Nursing, or Health Education.
  
  

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**  

In-depth understanding of community cultures, ethnicities, and local resources to address healthcare challenges effectively. Familiarity with Brooklyn-based healthcare systems is essential. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize goals effectively. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to build positive relationships with diverse populations, including underserved and hard-to-reach groups. Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Experience working with populations affected by HIV/AIDS, LGBTQ communities, and communities of color. Demonstrated ability to provide culturally and linguistically appropriate care. Proficiency in documenting patient interactions and maintaining accurate records.
  
  

**Salary Range:** $50,000
  
  

**Benefits Overview:** We offer attractive compensation with comprehensive benefits including: Medical, 401k Retirement Plan with discretionary Match, Free Life Insurance and Long-Term Disability, Transportation Plan, Generous Paid Vacations and Holidays.

title: Solar Energy Advisor
description:
**Solar Energy Advisor**

**About Us:**ActivSolar is a rapidly emerging as a leader in the solar industry, recognized as one of the fastest-growing full-service solar organizations in the tri-state area. At ActivSolar, we take immense pride in servicing our community while providing exceptional opportunities to our team members. We are seeking competitive and driven individuals who are eager to enhance their sales skills and achieve both personal and professional growth. Prospective team members will have the opportunity to be mentored by senior professionals, providing an invaluable opportunity to gain deep insights into the industry and accelerate their career growth. Join us in our mission to elevate the industry and have a meaningful impact in the renewable energy sector**.**

**Your Mission**

We are looking for polished, experienced sales representatives with a proven track record of successful customer installations. Your primary responsibility will be to promote solar awareness through proactive canvassing, express product knowledge, lead teams, and guiding clients through the transition to clean, sustainable energy.

**Why ActivSolar?**

* **Supportive Team Environment:** Collaborate with a dynamic team dedicated to mutual success.
* **Comprehensive Training:** Benefit from a full training platform and ongoing daily sessions to hone your skills and become a solar energy expert.
* **Opportunities for Promotion and Leadership Roles:** Grow your career with ample opportunities for advancement.

**What We Offer**

* **Mentorship Program:** Have the opportunity to work with top industry leaders.
* **Most Advanced Tools in the Industry:** Join a dynamic team that provides continuous support, company attire, the latest technology platform, and all necessary resources for your success.
* **Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy uncapped commission-based pay, with earning potential ranging from $100,000 to $300,000 per year.
* **Fantastic Benefits:** Medical & Dental coverage, Gym Membership, Paid Phone Plans, Gas Reimbursement.

**Your Responsibilities**

* Represent ActivSolar with professionalism and passion, ensuring a positive customer experience at every touchpoint.
* Exceed individual and team sales goals by leveraging excellent communication skills and resilience.
* Embrace continuous learning opportunities to sharpen your skills and advance your career.
* Provide top-notch customer service by proactively managing accounts and addressing customer needs.

**Qualifications**

* At least two years of relevant solar industry experience.
* Positive attitude and strong work ethic.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Coachable, self-motivated, and capable of working under pressure.
* Resourceful problem-solver with exceptional critical thinking skills.
* Must be 18 years or older with reliable transportation and a smartphone (iOS preferred).

**Core Values We Seek**

* **Strong Work Ethic:** Ready to put in the hours to achieve your goals.
* **Excellent Communication:** Build rapport and articulate product benefits effectively.
* **Integrity:** Operate with honesty and transparency.
* **Resilience:** Bounce back from setbacks with determination.
* **Customer Focus:** Prioritize customers' needs to build trust and loyalty.
* **Results-Driven:** Always striving to exceed expectations and improve performance.

**Job Details**

* **Type:** Employee or Independent Contractor
* **Pay:** Uncapped commission-based
* **Benefits:** Flexible schedule, great perks, opportunities for advancement
* **Location:** Hybrid in office/remote in Westchester-NY, availability for evening and Saturday shifts
* **Age Requirement:** Must be 18 years or older

Join ActivSolar and have the opportunity to be part of one the fastest growing organizations in the tri-state. For a faster response please email your resume directly to JoinOurTeam@ActivSolar.Pro

title: Crew Leader
description:
Free movies, free popcorn, flex schedules…and more! Support operations to achieve AMC’s guest, associate, and financial goals while developing leadership skills in preparation for a supervisor role.
**Benefit Summary**


Do you love all things movies? If so, you may be a perfect fit for our team. Build strong communication, leadership, and time management skills at AMC, and take advantage of our opportunities for career advancement. AMC team members enjoy free popcorn daily, half off eats and drinks, flexible schedules, ability to work with friends, and most importantly for us movie people…FREE movies at any of our theatres nationwide!  

  

AMC’s company culture is focused on innovation and diversity to ensure that we provide the latest and greatest experience for our guests and associates. We lead by example in doing what is right and take responsibility for our own results and our company’s success.  

  

**Job Description**


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

* Deliver superior service when connecting with AMC guests and leading associates.
* Optimize Crew placement for each job function on a round-by-round basis.
* Assist with assigning breaks and jobs within an assigned area.
* Reinforce the Wardrobe 101 Standards with Crew.
* Peer coach on sales pitch for AMC Stubs.
* Resolve guest questions, concerns and issues, including distribution of passes when appropriate.
* Focus on delivery of friendly, clean, and quick Overall Satisfaction (OS) drivers.
* Follow-up on opening & closing duties, as well as Theatre Clean Up Program (TCUP), Kitchen Clean Up Program (KCUP) or MacGuffins Clean Up Program (Mac-CUP) assignments for the day.
* Train and support theatre crew to execute, coach, monitor and assist coordination of Safe and Clean protocols.
* Oversee line checks, stocking, Freestyle/condiment areas, and back bar/hot foods assembly.
* Distribute banks (box office, concession, guest service, and arcade).
* Provide change, as needed, using remote supply bank or floor safe.
* Pull cash from drawers and drop boxes and hand to a manager/supervisor to support timely drops.
* Distribute inventory to support the Food & Beverage stand.
* Secure inventory during theatre closing.
* Restock CAABOs (Cash Accepting Automated Box Offices) with monetary supplies.
* Assist with inventory processes and stock room organization.
* Assist with voids, refunds, seat blocking, and line management.
* Assist with maintenance needs, as necessary.
* Assist with marketing change out of posters, standees, handouts, etc.
* Assist in booth operations.
* Assist with Radiant performance scheduling.
* Perform actual Crew functions, as business levels require.
* Perform other duties as directed by management (must align with Crew Access Policy).
* Maintain regular personal attendance for all scheduled shifts to ensure timely performance of duties.
* Uphold AMC’s Business Practice Standards and ensure compliance with company programs.


SKILL REQUIREMENTS

* Excellent guest service skills.
* Ability to communicate and work effectively with guests in high volume setting.
* Effective leadership and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively with supervisors and co-workers.
* Ability to work with minimal supervision.
* Ability to meet deadlines.
* Trained and able to demonstrate competency in all crew positions


UNIFORM

* Provided by Theatre: Nametag, red t-shirt.
* Provided by Associate: Black pants, slip resistant black shoes, socks, black belt.


AMC and its subsidiaries are committed to equal employment opportunity and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local employment laws. AMC strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination and will provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to an applicant's race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, military status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other reason prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law, regulation, or ordinance. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment.


**Minimum Job Requirements**


* Age 16 or older other location-specific age requirements may apply.


Requirements to be performed, with or without reasonable accommodation:

* Standing, walking, lifting, twisting, and bending on a frequent basis.
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds and carry it up to 90 feet (or deposit into dumpster or trash compactor)

**About AMC**


AMC amazing. That's the promise we deliver to nearly 35,000 associates, 240 million guests domestically, and 350 million guests worldwide each year. AMC has propelled industry innovation since 1920, and we continue to innovate by delivering premium sight and sound, new and improved food and beverage options, and diverse content in our state-of-the-art theatres. We focus on delivering friendly, superior service to our guests. We lead by example, have fun, and give back to the communities in which we live and work. If you feel motivated and energized by our culture, and if you can name your three favorite movies in the next 30 seconds, then AMC may be the right place for you. We offer competitive compensation, excellent benefits, and an environment that encourages teamwork, inclusion, collaboration, and results.

title: Luxury Fitness Center | (Part-Time) Front Desk - Jackson Park, LIC
description:
The Wright Fit
  
  

**The Pathway to an Extraordinary Quality of Life:** The Wright Fit has established itself as the premier Luxury Fitness and Amenities Management Company operating facilities in some of the most iconic residential and commercial buildings in New York City. By managing the facilities within residential and commercial buildings, we're given direct access into people's homes and workplaces, allowing us the opportunity to show them pathways to an extraordinary quality of life.
  
  

Job Summary
  
  

**The Wright Fit Team:**  

As an emerging leader in the fitness industry, there's no better place to gain first-hand experience at the crossroads of hospitality, health, wellness, and fitness. If you are a self-starter, customer focused, and a team player with a passion for fitness, then The Wright Fit is the right fit for you!
  
  

**Your Impact:**  

Our Luxury Fitness Center Attendants are responsible for delivering the highest quality customer service to all residents and guests through effective communication and extensive knowledge of The Wright Fit services and holistic approaches. Through relationship development, they will be able to proactively meet the needs of residents and guests and provide them with a platform to succeed!
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Provide high level customer service and hospitality to residents.
* Provide floor supervision and maintenance of the fitness center and equipment.
* Assist residents with any questions about the fitness center through knowledge of the equipment and services.
* Coordinate Personal training and other fitness services.
* Provide support to The Wright Fit specialists to ensure best service experience.
* Assist in organizing and managing events at the fitness center.
* Attentively and promptly respond to resident needs.
* Assist management in daily tasks and projects.
* Maintain a positive attitude and take initiative.
* Work as a cohesive team with all The Wright Fit team members to ensure efficiency and camaraderie.
* Maintain in conduct and actions The Wright Fit aesthetic, appearance, atmosphere, culture, vision, purpose and values.
* Compliance with quality assurance expectations and standards that may require you to sit, stand, or walk for extended periods of time, as well as lift and move heavy objects.


**What we're looking for:**  

* Hospitality or Customer Service experience preferred.
* A passion for fitness, health, and wellness.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and organization skills.
* Customer focused, able to manage conflict.
* Excellent time management, able to multi-task in a dynamic environment.
* Attention to detail, a self-starter and personally accountable.
* A positive attitude, team oriented.
* Ability to maintain the highest level of discretion and privacy.
* Attend and pass internal lifeguard certification.


**What you'll get:**  

* A supportive and passionate team of coworkers.
* Encouraging managers and leaders to learn from.
* Access to cutting edge information about the industry.


**Salary Range:** $17/hour
  
  

The Wright Fit is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. The Wright Fit does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

title: Afterschool ABA Behavior Technician / DSP Hudson (N)
description:
Sunshine Advantage is hiring in various locations in Bergen County. Locations include Closter.

**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.

**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**

Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location

Online and on the job training

Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career

to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)

Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA

Referral Bonus

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.

Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.

Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.

Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.

Collect accurate data daily.

Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.

Attends staff meetings and training as requested.

Completes additional job duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

High School Diploma, GED

Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism

Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.

Confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment and HIPAA requirements are required.

Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization

Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years

Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.

Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.

Background Clearance is mandatory.

Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

title: Urology Nurse Practitioner
description:
Take the next step toward your future with **Advanced Urology Centers of New York!** **Our growing Smithtown clinic is seeking a Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant to join their team in 2024.** 

* Smithtown Clinic located on the North Shore of Long Island
* Outpatient-focused model
* Flexible Monday through Friday schedule with no call
* Guaranteed annual base salary

Living in Suffolk County, NY, offers a blend of suburban tranquility, access to natural beauty, and proximity to the vibrant culture and opportunities of nearby New York City.

**Residential Environment:**

* Housing options in Suffolk County vary widely, from waterfront estates and upscale suburban neighborhoods to more affordable apartments and townhouses.
* The housing market can be competitive, especially in desirable areas close to the coast or with easy access to transportation links.

**Diverse Population**:

* Suffolk County is home to a diverse population, with residents representing a wide range of ethnicities, cultures, and backgrounds.

**Transportation**:

* Suffolk County is served by several major highways, including the Long Island Expressway (I-495), the Northern State Parkway, and the Southern State Parkway.
* Public transportation options include the Long Island Rail Road (LIRR), which provides commuter rail service to New York City, as well as Suffolk County Transit buses.

**Schools**:

* Suffolk County is served by numerous public school districts, as well as private and parochial schools.
* Higher education options include Stony Brook University, a major research institution, as well as Suffolk County Community College and several private colleges and universities.

**Shopping and Dining**:

* Smithtown residents are provided with ample opportunities for shopping and dining, whether they prefer browsing major retailers, exploring local boutiques, savoring gourmet meals, or sampling international flavors.

**Recreational Activities**:

* Suffolk County offers a wealth of recreational opportunities, including miles of coastline, parks, hiking trails, and golf courses.
* Cultural attractions abound, with museums, theaters, art galleries, and historic sites scattered throughout the county.
* The Hamptons, located on the eastern end of Suffolk County, are renowned for their luxury homes, upscale shops, and celebrity sightings.

**Healthcare Facilities**:

* Suffolk County is home to numerous hospitals and medical centers, providing a wide range of medical services, from primary care to specialized treatments.
* Major hospitals include Stony Brook University Hospital, a teaching hospital affiliated with Stony Brook University, and Southside Hospital in Bay Shore, which is part of the Northwell Health system.

**Cultural and Entertainment Venues**:

* Suffolk County boasts a vibrant arts scene, with numerous galleries, studios, and art centers showcasing the work of local and regional artists.
* The Suffolk Theater in Riverhead is a historic venue that hosts live music, comedy shows, theatrical performances, and other events throughout the year.
* Suffolk County is home to a thriving culinary scene, with an abundance of restaurants, cafes, and food trucks offering diverse cuisines, from farm-to-table fare to international specialties.

**Community Engagement**:

* Suffolk County is home to numerous civic organizations, neighborhood associations, and advocacy groups that work to address local issues, advocate for policy changes, and promote community empowerment.
* Suffolk County hosts a wide array of community events and festivals throughout the year, providing opportunities for residents to come together, celebrate diversity, and strengthen social bonds.
* Events such as street fairs, parades, cultural festivals, and farmers' markets showcase the county's rich heritage, arts, and culinary traditions, fostering a sense of belonging and pride among residents

**Safety and Security**:

* Suffolk County has robust emergency services, including fire departments, emergency medical services (EMS), and 911 dispatch centers.
* Suffolk County is served by several law enforcement agencies, including the Suffolk County Police Department (SCPD), which is the largest police department in the county.

Overall, life in Suffolk County offers a unique blend of suburban comfort, natural beauty, and access to urban amenities, making it an attractive destination for individuals and families seeking a high quality of life on Long Island.

**Solaris Health**  
AUCNY is affiliated with Solaris Health, the leading national group for clinical urology, and built on a foundation of like-minded healthcare professionals. With 15 private practice urology groups and 625+ providers serving over 885,000 unique patients annually across 13 states, Solaris Health is the nation’s largest urological services provider and is proud to be among the most innovative medical organizations in the United States.

title: Sales Representative
description:
**Auto Lenders is hiring sales consultants to deliver extraordinary customer experiences and guide them through their vehicle purchase.** 

**This isn’t your typical sales job - our top consultants come from backgrounds from all sales industries. We encourage you to apply if you come from a background like this!**

**We do not require automotive experience, we will train you from the ground up. Auto Lenders main focus is on the customer’s buying experience, and we are looking for representatives who will make their customer service experience an excellent one.**

**JOIN OUR TEAM**

If you are interested in working with us, we will speak to you more in-depth about what the role entails and what we offer, so that you are fully informed and on-board to join our team! The main reason people switch to the automotive industry is because our sales representatives can earn anywhere from $80K to $100K per year. The profession can be very lucrative.

We are different from most dealerships because we offer long-term stability and real career growth opportunities. We are also very different from most dealerships because we have an abundance of inventory. We do all of our inventory in house and do not rely on auctions or trade ins.

If you come from another sales industry and are on the fence about applying for an automotive sales role with us, we highly encourage you to apply, and we will chat with you more in depth to see if this opportunity aligns with what you are looking for!

**WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER**

* Competitive pay & commission (based on customer satisfaction)
* Medical, Dental, Life, Long and Short Term Disability Plans
* 401K options with employer contributions
* Many opportunities for career growth and advancement
* We promote from within
* Great managers and culture to help you succeed in your career

**APPLY WITH US!**

If you are ready for a rewarding career with competitive compensation and benefits, and opportunities to excel and advance, consider applying to Auto Lenders. Visit our website to learn more about Auto Lenders!

title: DSW Store Supervisor Full-Time
description:
**General Summary**


The Store Supervisor assists and performs the following functions alongside store management: customer service, merchandising, omni activities and all inventory related actions to drive sales and results. Demonstrates behaviors that align with the company values of Accountability, Collaboration, Humility and Passion. The Store Supervisor partners with the management team to understand daily/weekly/monthly store priorities. They participate in and support merchandise placement, fulfillment and store recovery. Store Supervisors participate in monitoring associate compliance to all company policies and procedures as well adherence to Asset Protection standards. They assist in assigned projects and tasks to support service levels which include opening and closing the store.

**Reports to:** Store Manager and/or Co-Manager

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

**Customer Service**

* Maintain In-Store Experience by modeling CEL behaviors, redirecting associate behaviors to achieve store goals and responding to customer requests and/or feedback with a high sense of urgency.
* Ensures customers have a positive experience by maintaining DSW store standards. Completes all tasking related to daily open/close including store cleaning, recovery and maintenance standards.
* Meets metric based goals by reviewing, understanding and clearly communicating daily/weekly/monthly goals. Able to clearly communicate business trends to SM/ML.
* Reviews daily communication; plans and assigns tasks throughout the day and follows through with required actions.
* Performs other duties as assigned by the Store Manager or other leader.

 **Inventory Management**

* Increase sales and success by maintaining sales floor and stockroom, enable the flow of merchandise to ensure an appealing experience to consumers.
* Supervises and participates in the planning and execution of all inventory management related activities including but not limited to; freight receipt, placement, markdown and MOOS.
* Responsible for all omni activities in store including but not limited to Charge/Send, BOPIS/BOSTS, Delivery.
* Leverages inventory reports to maximize productivity and merchandise presentation on the sales floor.
* Responsible for ensuring a safe environment for both customers and associates. Ensure all equipment is in good operating condition and checked regularly.
* Maintains supply inventory to ensure a successful floor moves, markdowns and fulfillment in areas of stockroom, cashwrap, clearance and non-sales areas.
* Performs, maintains and completes all information related to audits, donations, transfers, mismates, damages, etc.

 **Human Resources**

* Work closely with the store leadership team to understand and follow policy and procedure
* Assists the Store Manager and other leaders in recruiting/interview candidates
* Support team by training, coaching, directing associates and communicates development feedback of others to the management team in an efficient manner
* Provides feedback to the Store Manager on associate performance and communicates associate relations issues to Store Manager for follow up.
* Supports team in managing payroll and associate timekeeping activities
* Recognize associates through our company recognition tools.

 **Required Skills**

* Excellent customer service by exhibiting a positive mindset and enthusiasm
* Ability to manage in ambiguous situations to resolve internal and external conflict
* Ability to develop collaborative working relationships
* Ability to recognize what is critical and take action
* Good verbal and written communication skills
* Proven ability to train, coach, develop and motivate others
* Ability to hold team accountable to time bound expectations
* Time management
* Professionalism
* Must have availability to meet the needs of the business (i.e. shifts outside traditional business hours)
* Proficiency in basic computer use, including Microsoft Office

 **Experience**

* Minimum 2 years retail experience
* Some college preferred
* Minimum high school graduate **or equivalent**


The estimated pay range for this position is $21.85 to $27.30.


The successful candidate’s actual pay rate offer will take into account a wide range of job-related factors including skill sets, years and nature of relevant experience, training, pay rates of associates in similar positions, the candidate’s location, and other organizational needs. The estimated pay range has been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential. This range does not include benefits such as health insurance, paid or unpaid time off work, and/or retirement benefits, unless required by law. Benefits eligibility may vary based on where you work and your position. Click the link to learn more! Benefits (dswinc.com)

title: Apprentice - Heavy Equipment Operator - Long Island/ 5 Boroughs
description:
*Apprentice - Heavy Equipment Operator - Buffalo, NY*  
**About us**

**Earn while you learn! Apprenticeship is the other “4-year” degree – without any student debt!**

**YOU MUST Apply online at OUR APPRENTICES – Merit Apprenticeship Alliance (meritalliance.org)**

**The Merit Apprenticeship Alliance is seeking hardworking, honest, healthy minded Heavy Equipment Operator apprentices in the greater Central NY region.**

The Merit Apprenticeship Alliance will provide you with on-the-job training (OJT) (through employment with our contractors) and classroom training in the Heavy Equipment operation (the cost of training is paid from the benefit fund).

On-the-job training involves physical labor in heavy highway, building and environmental construction. Apprentices will learn how to safely perform pre- and post-operational checks, and operate and maintain Rollers and Compacting Machines, Graders, Bulldozers, Loaders and more!

**Sounds ok, but what is the pay?**

On prevailing wage projects (sometimes known as ‘union’ scale), **first term apprentices will earn between $18 and $22.45 per hour.** All wages will increase every 12 months. On private projects (during the slow season) first term apprentices will earn at least $18 per hour. Typically, apprentices work mostly on public projects.

**Want more?** The Alliance provides full benefits that include health insurance, training, supplemental unemployment, holiday, vacation and a pension – these benefits are part of your compensation and are worth at least $18.50 per hour.

**Interested? We are looking for someone who…**

· has a basic knowledge of materials, methods and tools of construction.

· is at least 18 years of age and has a high school or GED

· possesses a valid driver’s license.

· can provide their own reliable transportation to and from jobs sites and all classroom training (related instruction).

· is willing to travel “out of town” for related instruction and employment assignments (travel expenses are paid).

- can successfully complete a DOT drug screen as a condition of enrollment.

**You MUST apply online at OUR APPRENTICES – Merit Apprenticeship Alliance (meritalliance.org)**
