title: Communications & Culture Specialist
description:
**Our mission: to eliminate every barrier to mental health.**
-------------------------------------------------------------

  


At Spring Health, we're on a mission to revolutionize mental healthcare by removing every barrier that prevents people from getting the help they need, when they need it. Our clinically validated technology,**Precision Mental Healthcare**, empowers us to deliver the right care at the right time—whether it's therapy, coaching, medication, or beyond—tailored to each individual's needs.



We proudly partner with over 450 companies, from startups to multinational Fortune 500 corporations, as a leading provider of mental health service, providing care for 10 million people. Our clients include brands you use and know like Microsoft, Target, J.P. Morgan Chase, and Delta Airlines, all of whom trust us to deliver best-in-class outcomes for their employees globally. With our innovative platform, we've been able to generate a **net positive ROI** for employers and we are the only company in our category to earn **external validation** of net savings for customers.



We have raised capital from prominent investors including Generation Investment, Kinnevik, Tiger Global, William K Warren Foundation, Northzone, RRE Ventures, and many more. Thanks to their partnership and our latest Series E Funding, our current valuation has reached $3.3 billion. We're just getting started—join us on our journey to make mental healthcare accessible to everyone, everywhere.


We are seeking a **Communications and Culture Specialist** who is passionate about communications, storytelling, and the employee experience to join our People team. Reporting to the Associate Director of Internal Communications and Change Management, your role will be to develop clear communications plans and manage employee experience initiatives to build a more engaged, inclusive, and energized workforce. You'll work cross-functionally to translate complex concepts into concise messaging, create content that supports a range of exciting initiatives, and own ongoing projects to streamline company communications. Sitting within the People team, you'll also hold a dotted line reporting relationship to the Employee Experience Lead to support the coordination of many culture-focused programs that create meaningful connections, enhance collaboration, and empower teams – all to advance our employee mental health and performance.


**What you'll be doing:**


***Support Internal Communication across the organization by:***


* Managing our weekly employee newsletter, collaborating with teams across the org to curate and prioritize the most impactful company-wide updates.
* Providing support and coordination for internal comms initiatives, such as enhancing our company intranet.
* Cultivating strong relationships and building trust with subject matter experts across all levels and teams at Spring Health as you provide copy editing support, ask insightful questions to deeply understand the subject matter, offer strategic communications guidance, and develop comprehensive, employee-facing communication plans.
* Creating compelling employee storytelling, messaging, and collateral across different mediums: email, Slack, our intranet, video, FAQs, presentations, and one-sheets.
* Supporting the reinforcement of new and existing communications guidelines
* Overseeing the content calendar for company-wide messaging, events, and programming, ensuring the org is not overwhelmed with information by playing "air traffic control."
* Driving communications that elevates our existing People team programming, such as our benefits, growth opportunities, DEI initiatives and Employee Resource Groups that increase employee engagement, inclusion, and belonging
* Seeking, analyzing, and applying data to inform programming and strategy, while managing reporting for the Internal Communications function.
* ***Core KPIs: newsletter readership, intranet activity, employee engagement scores***


***Facilitate a culture of wellbeing and inclusion at Spring Health by:***


* Partnering with the Employee Experience Lead to execute the semi-annual Thriving Index survey, translating employee feedback into strategic action items, and facilitate unique employee experience initiatives
* Leading programming, such as Focus Weeks and Mental Health Summits, to promote wellbeing and connection among our distributed workforce
* Infusing opportunities for employee recognition across the org to celebrate work anniversaries, employee birthdays, topical holidays, and company milestones
* Partnering with the Head of Employee Experience to facilitate People Team events, from monthly All Hands to onsites
* ***Core KPIs: employee engagement scores***


**What we expect from you:**


* 3+ years of working experience within Communications; preferably familiarity with Employee Experience
* BA or BS required, preferably with a background in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Psychology, or related field
* Exceptional writing and copy editing abilities with a keen eye for detail and a talent for simplifying complex concepts into clear, engaging messaging
* Scrappy, adaptive self-starter who thrives in collaborative environments and can manage projects independently
* A resourceful, critical thinker with excellent judgment
* Deeply passionate about Employee Experience and Company Culture
* Team player who is eager to learn, receptive to feedback, and approaches problem-solving with a holistic mindset
* Experience with intranet content management and change management is a plus
* Completion of a writing assessment will be part of the interview process
* NY-based preferred


*The target base salary range for this position is* ***$******86,000 - $106,250****, and is part of a competitive total rewards package including stock options and benefits. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by a number of factors including experience, location, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We review all employee pay and compensation programs annually at minimum to ensure competitive and fair pay.*



Don't meet every requirement? Studies have shown that **women, communities of color and historically underrepresented** talent are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Spring Health **we are dedicated** to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!


**Ready to do the most impactful work of your life? Learn more about our values, how we work, and how hypergrowth meets impact at Spring Health:****Our Values**


**Hypergrowth meets impact**


**What to expect working here:**


* You will be held accountable to an exceptionally high bar and impact
* This may be the fastest work environment you will ever experience in terms of growth, decision-making, and time to impact
* You will be empowered to set your own boundaries and asked to adapt them in critical moments when the company needs you
* You will create processes & products that have never existed before
* You will have very direct conversations and receive continuous feedback to push you to become the most thriving team member and performer you can be
* Change is a constant here: your role, team, responsibilities, and success metrics will shift as the company grows


**And…**


* You get to be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the field
* You get to learn and grow at an extremely accelerated pace
* You will experience transparency, integrity, & humility from leadership
* You will be empowered to constantly challenge the status quo
* You get the space to experiment & innovate
* You get to make a transformational impact for the company, mental health, and for real human lives — and you will see that impact quickly
* You will become more resourceful and resilient
* You get to be part of a winning team that opens doors in the future


**Benefits provided by Spring Health:**


*Your Total Health:*

  

* Health, Dental, Vision benefits start on your first day at Spring Health. You and your dependents also receive an individual **One Medical**account which is valued at $199/year per user. HSA and FSA plans available
* A yearly allotment of no cost visits to the Spring Health network of therapists, coaches, and medication management providers for you and your dependents
* 10 allocated sick days per year
* Flexible paid time off in addition to 12 paid holidays throughout the year
* Access to **Gympass**, an on-demand virtual benefit that provides wellbeing coaching, and budget management.
* Spring Renewal: When you hit your four-year Springaversary, you'll be awarded afourweek**,** fullypaid**,** sabbatical leave to renew and recharge.


*You And Your family:*


* 4-4.5 months of fully paid parental leave
* Spring Health provides team members and their families with sponsored access to Bright Horizons® child care, back-up care, and elder care.
* Access to fertility care support through **Carrot**, in addition to $4,000 reimbursement for related fertility expenses


*Supporting you financially through:*


* Our People team benchmarks all salaries using the**Radford Global Compensation Database**for technology and life sciences industries. Radford benchmarks salaries with 3,589 global firms, 6.5 million employees, and 98 countries across the globe. We do this to ensure all of our team members are paid equally and competitively.
* On top of competitive and benchmarked salary, Spring Health offers incentive pay (based on role), and equity that begins vesting as we celebrate your first year with the company!
* Employer sponsored 401(k) match of up to 2% after 90 days of employment


*Creating a culture you can thrive in:*


* Flexible work arrangements: 66% of Spring Health team members work fully remote while 33% work in a hybrid model from our New York City offices
* Focus Fridays: no meetings, no distractions, just time for you to get work done.
* Focus Weeks: In Spring 2023, we held our first ever Focus Week, we canceled all non-essential meetings, minimized distractions, and you, our team members, to dive into the key work that gets chopped up or deprioritized during the regular day-to-day. We saw a 36% jump in the average energized score after those five days of flow state work and are finalizing a plan for quarterly Focus Weeks for team members.
* Up to $1,000 Professional Development Reimbursement per calendar year.
* $200 per year donation matching to support your favorite causes


***Our privacy policy:*** ***https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/***



Don't meet every requirement? Studies have shown that **women, communities of color and historically underrepresented** talent are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Spring Health **we are dedicated** to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace



To ensure intentional and equitable hiring practices, we use a balanced candidate slate in our interviews. This approach **guarantees** that our pool of qualified candidates includes individuals who are **underrepresented** in our organization at *all levels.* This is a key performance indicator (KPI) for our recruiting and hiring teams, reported quarterly to maintain accountability.

title: Registered Nurse Care Coordinator/Cardiac Telemetry
description:
**We are seeking Registered Nurse Care Coordinator/Cardiac Telemetry professionals to join our healthcare team.**

***On Site Role in Melville, NY***

***MUST have good data review experience with EKG results!***

Provides intermediate to expert level analysis of arrhythmias on intracardiac electrograms, technical device data, test results, and physiologic data for all Cardiac Implantable Electronic Device (CIED) types and manufacturers. Works with the Hubs to process transmissions for CIED scheduled and alerts, following the company’s service-level agreement timelines.

**Essential Duties/Responsibilities**

* Analyze and Interpret CIED transmission data autonomously using company software provided
* Process alert and scheduled transmissions independently, without oversight
* Document findings clearly and concisely following company protocol on reporting requirements, standards, and format
* Escalate device abnormalities through company workflow process
* Escalate urgent and emergent abnormalities directly to the customer
* Meet or exceed quality and productivity standards
* Provide troubleshooting support as requested
* Complete all assigned and required training; stay up to date on developing clinical knowledge, specifically ECG rhythm interpretation
* Follow all company and departmental policies and procedures
* Work directly with patient engagement team to re-engage disconnected patients
* Maintain manufacturer portals, patient schedules, and alert programming
* Stay current on new products, solutions, and CIED management offerings

**Education and Experience Requirements**

* Education: High School Diploma or General Educational Development (GED)
* Relevant Work Experience:
* Successfully completed CIED Remote Monitoring Course,
* 1 - 2 years direct experience
* Experience with in-office and remote CIED interrogations of all four medical device manufacturers (Biotronik, Abbott, Boston Scientific, and Medtronic) or previous field clinical specialist experience with one of the four manufacturers
* Experience utilizing all four home monitoring websites preferred
* 2 - 5 years related industry experience

**Licenses/Certifications:**

* CCDS, CEPS, CDRMS preferred
* CRAT/CCT

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Expert arrhythmia recognition and interpretation
* Intermediate to expert CIED management fundamental knowledge
* Intermediate to expert electrogram (EGM) interpretation skills
* Intermediate to expert knowledge and navigation of the external manufacturer portals

**SCHEDULE:**

* M-F day shift and flex w/start/end time, also open to 8 or 10 hour shifts

26 Week contract to start with potential for long term based on Performance and Budget

title: Associate Editor, Choices
description:
Job Description:
THE OPPORTUNITY
The associate editor for Choices will be closely involved in all aspects of producing a health and life-skills magazines for students in grades 6-12 nationwide. In addition to writing and editing health and life-skills articles for students, the associate editor will work closely with freelancers to create supplemental educational resources, such as reading comprehension activities, Spanish translations of articles, and vocabulary slideshows. The associate editor will work both independently and collaboratively to help shepherd each issue of the magazine from conception to publication. The associate editor will also act as chief liaison for student and teacher advisory boards. Additionally, the assoicate editor will assist in developing content for videos and other digital assets. Other duties as needed.
RESPONSIBILITIES* Overseeing creation and production of freelancer-provided educational assets such as skill sheets and lesson plans; assisting in freelancer-provided Spanish language translations of each issue; proofreading each issue and liaising with professional proofreader for each issue.
* Writing and/or editing at least two stories per issue, with the opportunity to take on more writing assignments with time
* Maintaining student advisory board and assigning and top-editing student-written debate articles; maintaining teacher advisory board, sending out surveys and communications, coordinating in-person and remote class visits, and monitoring and updating Facebook page.
* Additional administrative tasks including maintaining payment system for freelancers, mailing magazines to contributors, and other tasks as needed.
* Preparing and shepherding e-newsletters and subscriber surveys through publication process.
* Assisting with brainstorming ideas for and writing scripts for videos for Choices website.

  

WHO WE ARE
Scholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of core literacy curriculum and professional services, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs for pre-K to grade 12, classroom magazines and other products and services that support children's learning both in school and at home. With operations in 14 international offices and exports to 165 countries, Scholastic makes quality, affordable books available to all children around the world through school-based book clubs and book fairs, classroom collections, school and public libraries, retail and online. True to its mission of 100+ years to encourage the personal and intellectual growth of all children beginning with literacy, the Company has earned a reputation as a trusted partner to educators and families. Learn more at www.scholastic.com.
Some benefits that we offer:* Full suite of health and wellness benefits (including a $0 deductible Medical Plan)
* Retirement Savings Plan 401(k) with options for both Roth and Traditional Contributions
* Tuition-Free programs for undergraduate and graduate degrees
* Generous Parental Leave Program
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) with opportunity for discounted stock at a 15% discount


Thank you for your consideration in choosing Scholastic.
Qualifications
HOW YOU CAN FIT (Qualifications)
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
The ideal candidate will be able to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment and prioritize short- and long-term assignments. Must have the ability to effectively work independently, take initiative on tasks, and collaborate with others both across the Magazines Plus group as well as outside of Scholastic. Must also have the ability to write clear, captivating, age-appropriate articles that will engage students in middle and high school. Meticulous proofreading skills required. Creativity and a passion for producing high-interest content for students is essential. Knowledge of trends in education — including evolving standards, curricula, and assessments — is a plus, as is familiarity with current research on health and life-skills for teens. Familiarity with Spanish preferred.
Experience and Education:
Experience: A minimum of three years’ writing/editing experience, preferably in educational/children’s publishing
Education: Bachelor’s degree required

Full time

Regular

Guild

title: Nanny
description:
**We are seeking experienced and qualified career nannies to join our team!**

**Job Description: A marvelous family of three is looking for an awesome nanny to join them. They have one infant and would love someone who can grow to be a part of their family. Benefits and competitive pay available.**

**Hours: 35+ hours a week**

**Schedule: Monday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday with open availability to work Tuesdays as well**

**Salary: $22.00-$30.00 an hour**

**Children and Ages: 1 newborn** 

**Responsibilities:**

**As a Nanny, you would provide complete care for the child(ren) in the employer's home and perform all tasks that correlate to the care of the children. To create a safe, nurturing and stimulating environment in which the children can thrive and develop.**

* **Keep the play area safe and free from hazards while monitoring children consistently throughout the day.**
* **Sanitize play equipment, games and toys on a regular basis to keep them safe and attractive while minimizing the spread of germs.**
* **Change diapers, dress children and assist them with their snacks, drinks and meals as needed.**
* **Teach children the importance of good personal hygiene and health habits, including the importance of brushing teeth, eating healthy food, using the toilet and getting adequate rest.**
* **Engage in educational activities with the children, including reading, crafts, drawing, coloring and singing.**
* **Keep an individual record for each child that includes information about his or her behaviors, daily activities, meals eaten, medications received and other important and mundane details. Discuss this information with each child’s parents on a daily or weekly basis.**
* **Discipline unruly children as needed, focusing on using creative ways to encourage good behavior such as picking up after themselves, participating in the lesson plans and treating each other kindly.**
* **Create daily lesson plans that are developmentally appropriate, fun and interesting. Lesson plans should always encourage full participation from each child.**

**Basic Qualifications:**

* **Must be 18+ years**
* **High School Graduate**
* **Reliable transportation**

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* **Training in First Aid or CPR**
* **6 months or more of childcare experience**

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

title: IT Inventory Associate
description:
**WHO WE ARE**



Veterinary Emergency Group (VEG) is a rapidly growing emergency company with hospital locations across the United States. Our mission is helping people and their pets when they need it most. We are revolutionizing emergency medicine with a "customer first" mentality and a true, employee-centric work environment.

  


**TALENT + CULTURE AT VEG**



At VEG, we want people and their pets to feel safe, secure, and valued; we want our employees to feel the same way. What we're aiming to achieve on the customer side is equivalent in nature to what we want for our employees: to have the best experience possible. With the highest NPS score in our industry, we're ready to ensure that VEG remains the place where the best and brightest in the emergency world not only want to work, but stay and grow. For our customers and their pets, we strive to find a way to say, "yes." We do the same and more for our teams. In fact, VEG is one of this year's nominees for INC Magazine's Best Places to Work!


**THE ROLE'S MISSION**



VEG's Technology team supports over 80+ VEG hospitals through ticketing, field visits, phone calls, and hardware configuration. A high volume of equipment flows through our HQ in White Plains, NY and needs to be audited and tracked daily to ensure accurate inventory to fulfill our hospitals' requests. The inventory associate will notify leadership of any backorder risks, and collaborate with procurement vendors to source comparable equipment. This role will be directly responsible for ensuring all inventory in the IT storage room is accurate, and unpacking IT deliveries the office receives daily. They will enter relevant asset information into our database and handle any device repairs and RMA's. In addition, this role will monitor hardware warranty expirations and track hardware that will need to be refreshed due to age.

  


**WHO WE NEED**



You are a passionate, motivated individual with prior experience managing high volume inventory. You are eager to learn and grow and can function as a part of the team; cross collaborating with other departments when necessary. You are comfortable adapting to new scenarios, pivoting when priorities change, willing to learn new techniques, and have a solution-oriented mindset. You have excellent interpersonal capabilities across a diverse group. You're happy to pitch in wherever and whenever you are needed, with a positive attitude. You demonstrate the ability to accomplish assigned tasks, follow written documentation, and know when to ask for help.

  


**WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT TO DO**


* Daily inventory counts and audits for all IT devices and equipment
* Order, receive and stock inventory received to VQ
* Check for low stock on equipment daily and notify leadership
* Monitor and audit product turnover to adjust reorder quantities
* Monitor and clearly communicate backordered items and find comparable item
* Maintain procurement vendor relationships
* Mark when boxes are received and enter serial numbers into inventory
* Log up to 50 device serial numbers per day
* Receive deliveries, unbox packages and add to inventory
* Prepare daily outgoing packages and create shipping labels
* Organize IT stock room
* Understand basic computer troubleshooting
* Track hardware warranties and flag when equipment should be refreshed due to age
* Oversee all hardware repairs and RMA's
* Collaborate with team members to get hardware to our hospitals quickly and efficiently through tickets
* Prepare daily outgoing packages

  


**WHAT YOU NEED**


* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 1+ years of experience in inventory management
* Flexibility in schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays
* Possess strong communication skills, written, verbal, or other
* Ability to learn how to use software programs such as monday.com, Oomnitza, and JAMF
* Ability to lift up to 50lbs on your own

  


**BENEFITS**


* Pay Range: $65,000 - $75,000
* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits beginning day 1 of employment!
* 401K with company match.
* 10 weeks of parental leave with 100% pay.
* Unlimited PTO.
* Company laptop and a monthly cell phone reimbursement.
* Casual office attire, dog friendly, and a kitchen full of snacks and beverages!
* Opportunity to grow and so much more!

  



VEG celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. You've found the equal-opportunity employer you are looking for. We can't wait to meet you!

title: Associate Consultant, Water Resources Engineering
description:
At WSP, we know our work today informs the world we will live in tomorrow. We thrive to build communities that must be more resilient, more equitable and prepared to meet the challenges of a changing climate. WSP is currently initiating a search for a Full-Time Early Career Water Resources Engineer to join our growing NYC Water Team to work out of our One Penn Plaza, NY office, to support our community focused, equitable and future ready water resources projects regionally and nationwide. You will be involved in a variety of projects with our Water Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our clients' objectives and solves their challenges.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Develop computer models utilizing simulation software to analyze flow conditions and terrain characteristics.
* Assist with performing basic professional water resources engineering work relating to water supply/quality/management, stormwater facilities, floodplain modeling/mapping, hydrologic/hydraulic modeling, culvert/open channel/bridge hydraulics, canal development, river/stream/habitat restoration and fish passage, and preserving the quality of the environment by averting the contamination and degradation of water resources.
* Utilize GIS to manage bathymetry, topography, and various datasets.
* Maintain quality control standards and procedures for accurate and precise measurements.
* Assist with verifying the characteristics of a site, providing entry-level technical assistance on various environmental issues.
* Prepare detailed reports, presentations, and visual materials for client communication
* Engage in client meetings to contribute your insights and findings
* Employ digital tools like SharePoint and PowerBI to enhance collaboration among team members and clients
* Comply with safety guidelines and site-specific procedures which include but are not limited to, the maintenance of sample collection, location data, statistical documentation, and logbooks.
* Complete training on assigned tasks.
* Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
* Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.
* Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
* Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Excellent research skills with analytical mindset.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, with a focus in Water Resources or closely related discipline.
* 1-3 years of relevant post-education experience.
* Familiarity with the concepts of professional water resources engineering work relating to water supply, quality, management, and treatment for various end uses – recreationally, commercially, and/or industrially.
* Familiarity with relevant environmental laws, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.
* Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.
* Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.
* Ability to work independently under general supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.
* Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, technology, math principles, predictive models, spreadsheets, and tools.
* Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
* Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.
* Occasional local travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.
The selected candidate must have the ability to work in the United States immediately.  
* 

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Prior internship experience, leadership experience, or relevant coursework
* Engineer in Training Certification.
* A member of and/or actively participate in local professional practice organizations.
Experience using Microsoft Office, ArcGIS, AutoCAD, Civil3D, HydroCAD, HEC-RAS, and/or HEC-HMS  
* 

  

**WSP Benefits:**

WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career. These benefits include coverage related to medical, dental, vision, disability, and life; retirement savings; paid sick leave; paid vacation (or other personal time); paid parental leave; and paid time off for purposes of bereavement, voting, and/or attendance at naturalization proceedings.


**Compensation**  

Expected Salary: $65,400 - $107,910
  

WSP USA is providing the compensation range that the company in good faith believes it might pay and offer for this position, based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities in addition to internal equity and specific geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, and/or federal law.

title: Market Leader, Transmission & Distribution
description:
This Opportunity


**Why WSP?** Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.


***The Market Leader-Transmission & Distribution*** is responsible for overseeing and leading the technical T&D practice in Canada. This includes leading projects and being responsible for certain accounts and engagements, as well as the overall compliance with national and local regulations, and maintaining high standards of service reliability and customer satisfaction.  



  

WSP is a leader in the delivery of clean energy and ***Power sector*** solutions to meet the increasing demand for safe, secure, and sustainable energy for Canadians which requires a substantial expansion of the electricity transmission network. In this leadership role, you will help bring WSP’s vast expertise, experience, and innovation to support our clients, utilities, and communities in the transformation to a new energy
  

future. #WSP-ERI


Your Impact


* You will be the Technical Market Leader for T&D, reporting to Vice-President-Power
* You will be responsible for leading and growing the Transmission and Distribution practice
* You will act as a thought leader, applying advanced in-depth and broad knowledge and be externally recognized as a top “go-to” resource in their field
* You will make decisions on highly complex issues regarding work approach for project components and completion of team tasks and responsibilities
* You will anticipate business needs, secure required resources, and lead initiatives to implement change in the organization
* You will make recommendations and be involved with important decision-making on highly technical
  

and complex aspects of WSP projects
* You will be accountable to lead certain client accounts and engagements within T&D
* You will support the growth of technical disciplines required for T&D
* You will ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards and provide oversight and governance on the various major project ongoing within the T&D team
* You will provide governance on T&D jobs including quality, and provide leadership on T&D proposals
* You will collaborate with other internal departments and stakeholders to improve quality and project delivery, including management of subconsultants
You will mentor and coach other T&D staff as required.  
* 

Who You Are


**Required Qualifications**

* More than 12+ years’ experience in a leadership role and must have experience in the Power sector with Transmission & Distribution.
* Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or technical diploma from post-secondary institution is required
* Proven experience in business development with an existing network in the Transmission & Distribution market
* Strong financial and business acumen - experience with managing business operations and/or a P&L is an asset
* Strong understanding of the energy sector, including industry trends and emerging technologies related to the energy transformation and decarbonization
* Ability to negotiate and build relationships with clients
* P.Eng. or P.Tech. designation is an asset
* Bilingual in both French and English is an asset.

  

  

  
**About WSP**WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper.


www.wsp.com


WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.


At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?


WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.


The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.


**NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:**

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, employment agencies, or other staffing services. Unsolicited resumes include any resume or hiring document sent to WSP in the absence of a signed Service Agreement where WSP has expressly requested recruitment/staffing services specific to the position at hand. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, will become the property of WSP and WSP will have the right to hire that candidate without reservation – no fee or other compensation will be owed or paid to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service.

title: Comic Book Creation Instructor (Part Time)
description:
**Job Title:** Comic Book Instructor
  
  

**Job Type:** Part-Time, Independent Contractor
  
  

Job Summary
  
The Comic Book Instructor will provide custom-tailored curriculum and direct instruction to K-12 students. This role is tasked with the design, implementation, and instruction of a comprehensive curriculum focused on comic book creation. The curriculum will aim to foster creativity while also enhancing literacy, storytelling, and visual narrative skills in students. The capstone of this course is a final project where students will create their own comic books.
  
  

General Responsibilities
  
1. Design and implement a comic book creation curriculum tailored to the needs and interests of students.
  
2. Lead comic book creation sessions, imparting essential skills like storytelling, drawing techniques, and panel layout.
  
3. Create a safe, respectful, and engaging learning environment for all students.
  
4. Assess students' comic book creation skills and provide constructive feedback.
  
5. Monitor student progress, maintaining accurate records for educational and administrative purposes.
  
6. Establish and maintain regular communication with parents, guardians, and educational stakeholders about student performance and program updates.
  
7. Ensure all essential materials such as drawing tablets, sketchbooks, and software are properly set up, maintained, and stored.
  
  

Major Duties
  
**1. Curriculum Development:** Plan and create lesson plans and learning modules that incorporate advanced techniques in storytelling, character development, and narrative cohesion.
  
**2. Classroom Instruction:** Manage and lead classes ensuring that each student is actively engaged and benefiting from the learning experience.
  
**3. Student Assessment:** Continuously evaluate student progress, and adapt instructional techniques to meet individual learning needs.
  
**4. Community Building:** Create a classroom culture that promotes teamwork, constructive critique, and mutual respect.
  
**5. Technology Management:** Guarantee the optimal functioning of digital tools used for instruction, such as drawing tablets and comic book creation software.
  
**6. Documentation and Reporting:** Maintain precise records of student attendance, evaluation results, and instructor feedback, submitting comprehensive reports as needed.
  
  

Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
  
* Instructional Skills: The ability to design and implement a curriculum that is both age-appropriate and educationally enriching is required.
* Communication Skills: Strong skills in both verbal and written communication are essential for effective interactions with students, parents, and staff.
* Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional teamwork and collaboration skills are essential, and the candidate must be open to receiving and acting on feedback.
* Organizational Skills: Effective time management skills, with the capability to prioritize tasks and adhere to deadlines, are necessary.
* Content Knowledge: Candidates must possess extensive expertise in all areas of comic book creation, including but not limited to, storytelling, graphic design, and illustrative techniques.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**About Sheba Foods:**  

Sheba Foods is dedicated to bringing the vibrant and diverse flavors of African cuisine to kitchens across the country. We pride ourselves on offering high-quality products that are delivered with precision and care. As we continue to grow, we are looking for passionate and motivated individuals to join our team and help us maintain our reputation for excellence.
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Warehouse Associate to join our team. In this role, you will be a key player in our warehouse operations, ensuring that products are accurately stored, organized, and prepared for shipment. Your ability to work efficiently and maintain a high level of accuracy will be crucial in helping us deliver our products to customers on time.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Product Handling: Efficiently receive, unload, and organize incoming shipments, ensuring all items are correctly stored in their designated locations.
* Inventory Management: Maintain accurate inventory records by regularly counting and organizing stock, reporting any discrepancies or shortages.
* Order Fulfillment: Assist in picking, packing, and preparing orders for shipment, ensuring that all products are handled with care and meet our quality standards.
* Warehouse Organization: Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and free of hazards, optimizing space for better workflow and efficiency.
* Quality Control: Conduct regular checks on products to ensure they are in good condition and meet the company’s standards before shipping.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with other team members to ensure smooth and efficient warehouse operations, assisting in other areas as needed.


**Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in a warehouse or logistics role is beneficial but not required.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Basic computer skills for managing inventory and orders.
* Physical stamina to lift and move items (up to 50 lbs) and stand for extended periods.


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive Pay: A salary that recognizes your hard work and dedication.
* Flexible Scheduling: Enjoy work hours that accommodate your personal life.
* Employee Discounts: Take advantage of discounts on our range of delicious products.
* Career Growth: Opportunities for advancement as our company continues to expand.
* Positive Work Environment: Be part of a team that values respect, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Nibav Lifts Inc. is a leader in the home elevator industry, known for our innovative, eco-friendly solutions that bring luxury and convenience to homes worldwide. We pride ourselves on our commitment to quality and excellence in everything we do. Join our team and be part of a company that values innovation, teamwork, and professional growth.
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Warehouse Associate to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring that our operations run smoothly, contributing directly to the satisfaction of our customers by ensuring that orders are processed accurately and efficiently.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Order Processing: Accurately pick, pack, and prepare orders for shipment, ensuring that all items meet quality standards and customer specifications.
* Inventory Management: Maintain accurate inventory records by conducting regular stock checks, organizing products, and reporting discrepancies.
* Loading and Unloading: Safely load and unload materials and products from delivery trucks, ensuring that items are handled with care to prevent damage.
* Quality Control: Inspect products for defects or damages before shipping, ensuring that only top-quality items reach our customers.
* Warehouse Organization: Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and safe by following company procedures and safety regulations.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with other team members to meet daily targets and contribute to a positive work environment.


**Qualifications:**  

* Previous experience in a warehouse or logistics role is a plus, but not required.
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
* Ability to lift and move heavy objects (up to 50 lbs) and stand for extended periods.
* Basic computer skills for inventory tracking and order processing.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive pay and benefits package.
* Opportunities for career advancement within a growing company.
* A supportive and collaborative work environment.
* Comprehensive training to ensure your success in the role.

title: Store Manager
description:
**WHY JOIN ALO?**



Mindful movement. It's at the core of why we do what we do at Alo—it's our calling. Because mindful movement in the studio leads to better living. It changes who yogis are off the mat, making their lives and their communities better. That's the real meaning of studio-to-street: taking the consciousness from practice on the mat and putting it into practice in life.

**OBJECTIVE**

  


The Store Manager is a true business owner for their store. They are responsible for leading, managing and continuously developing all aspects of their store's business. They are accountable for creating and maintaining a positive and highly productive work environment that aligns with the company's mission. They will be responsible for consistently achieving sales & profitability goals, operational objectives, merchandising standards and developing a highly successful Sales, Operations, and Visual team.



Business Leader


* Develop and execute the store's retail strategies
* Local market knowledge of clientele base and brand competitors
* Aware of business trends that relate to the success of the store
* Demonstrate strong business acumen through KPI's to develop and support business driving strategies
* Lead team by leveraging company tools, incentives & strategies to support meeting sales goals


People Leader


* Ensure that the store team exudes Alo's mission and guiding principles to effectively communicate to our visitors who we are, what we do and why we do what we do
* Develops an environment of growth, accountability and inclusivity through development, performance management, training and consistent coaching
* Conducts talent analysis of colleagues and establish career progression plans for key players and positions to result in retention of best talent and turnover reduction
* Establish internal & external pipeline through succession planning and recruitment strategy


Operations Leader


* Oversee Sales & Service, Operations, and Visual Managers to ensure execution of all key strategies
* Oversee and support execution of key operational and visual guidelines
* Champion strong visual standards for the salesfloor by leveraging business performance data
* Support a safe work environment and efficient operation


Business Partner


* Collaborate with cross-functional business partners to support organizational goals
* Be a brand ambassador and create a store culture that aligns with Alo's mission
* Demonstrate an ability to navigate the organization with a balance of business need and brand culture
* Create and implement effective communication strategies throughout store


Store Manager Qualifications:


* 5+ years of retail or related industry leadership experience
* Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook)
* Extraordinary interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
* Agile with the ability to handle multiple tasks in a changing environment
* Highly Motivated by driving business in a fast-paced, innovative environment
* Business owner mindset with an entrepreneurial spirit
* Independent work ethic, time management skills, and personal accountability
* Aligns with and embodies Alo's guiding principles
* Seniority Level: Mid-Senior level


To build a balanced schedule that supports the needs of the business and our teams, we expect all full-time employees to have open availability and are expected to work variable shifts including peak days and weekends. All employees without exception are expected to be able to work during the company's Blackout period, from the week of American Thanksgiving (including Black Friday and Thanksgiving weekend) through the end of the holiday season (the 1st week of January).


**JUST SOME OF THE PERKS**

  

* Generous employee discount for Bella+Canvas, Alo Yoga, and free membership to Alo Moves, with access to hundreds of streaming fitness and yoga classes with top instructors
* Competitive medical, dental and vision plan options, and enhanced additional benefits such as free virtual access to mental health providers and new parent support for employees and dependents (Full-Time Employees)
* 401K with company matching (Full-Time Employees)
* Monthly Store Incentives
* Clothing Allowance
* Free yoga classes at any of our Sanctuaries


The Company's Store Manager base pay ranges from $75,000 - $90,000/ year. Please also note, Store Managers are eligible to participate in the Company's Monthly Store Incentive which may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range. Further, the range listed is just one component of the Company's total rewards package for retail employees. Other rewards may include: clothing allowance, employee discount, 401K, competitive medical, dental, and vision plans, commuter benefits, Talkspace, and AloMoves.



#LI-JJ1



#LI-4



#li-onsite



Please review our company California Job Applicant Privacy Policy HERE.

title: FT Support Supervisor
description:
We are an American luxury lifestyle brand, founded in 2004. Anchored in the casual elegance of American sportswear, Tory’s design philosophy is defined by effortless silhouettes, innovative materials, eclectic juxtapositions of color, and the tension of past and present. The collections include ready-to-wear, handbags, footwear, accessories, jewelry, home and beauty.
Empowering women is the company’s guiding principle, expressed through Tory’s collections and reflected in the company culture as well as the work of the Tory Burch Foundation. Established in 2009, the Foundation provides women entrepreneurs in the United States with capital, education and community.
You are seeking a work environment where people are encouraged to dream, explore, discover and, as important, laugh together. If you’re prepared to work hard, create impact, and have fun while doing it, we would love to have you join #TeamTory. Apply today!
Life @ToryBurch is Special Because:
When you join us, you’re joining a purpose-led company on an exciting growth journey with the best Retail Team in the industry.
Our culture is welcoming and inclusive * - everyone is empowered to make a difference.
* We have the best team in the world and believe in paying competitively and rewarding high performance.
* Your overall well-being is important to us; we offer benefits to help you take care of your mental and physical health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life.
* We love seeing our employees wear our beautiful collections. You’ll receive a generous employee discount and access to exclusive special offers.
* We will help you become great at what you love - Our Retail Excellence Programs in Styling, Coaching, Brand Ambassador (just to name a few) and supportive Retail Leaders are there to support you each step of the way
* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.


This Role is Tailor-Made For You Because:
You are a flexible individual who is comfortable multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment with constantly changing priorities, supporting front of the house and back of the house operations. You’re also resourceful and collaborative, highly motivated and efficient. A sense of humor is a plus!
A Day In The Life:
The typical day is… atypical. You might be acting greeter, runner, cashier, answering phones, understanding and executing operational policies and procedures, packing/unpacking shipments, and organizing the stock room to support product flow and the smooth running of the store. As the Support Supervisor, you lead by example, managing conflict and identify opportunities to support the team in delivering a transformational customer experience. The consistent thread is that you’ll be working with an amazing team of women and men who share your passion for excellence.
To Land This Role:* 2 to 4 years experience in a high volume, customer-driven retail environment, stock-related experience a plus
* Must have open availability for a flexible work schedule that meets the needs of the business, including overnights, evenings, holidays and weekend shifts
* Ability to lift (at least 40 lbs), carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb ladders, crawl, reach, bend and stand for extended periods of time
* Must be at least 18 years of age


Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team:
Our Retail Teams are known for making every customer feel welcome and creating the most memorable experiences for them. They help to grow our business every single day. Our store teams are encouraged to think like entrepreneurs and to experiment with innovative ideas that make it easier for them to deliver retail excellence. Come join us!
How We Work Together* Adaptable – We change before we have to
* Entrepreneurial – We own it
* Collaborative – There’s no “I” in Tory
* Client & Brand Focused – We put ourselves in Tory’s shoes
* Live the Values – We show up for each other
* Functional Expertise – We’re constantly learning and growing


#TeamTory Values
We show up with honesty & kindness, act with integrity & compassion, work with passion & humility and lead with excellence & humor.
Compensation Range
The compensation range for this position is 17.00 USD - 24.00 USD. Our offer will be based on your relevant experience and work location.
Benefits Information
We offer a generous set of benefits to help you take care of your health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Here are highlights of key benefits available to all Tory Burch members that work over 30 hours.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.
Disability Accommodation
Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require assistance or an accommodation with the hiring process, please contact thetalentteam@toryburch.com.

title: Dental Billing & Credentialing Manager
description:
**Please Note:** This position is full-time on-site.
### **OUR POSITION:**


We are seeking an experienced and dedicated insurance & credentialing manager to join our dental support organization within the Revenue Cycle department. This role is crucial in ensuring the smooth and efficient management of various insurance-related processes, including credentialing, auditing, clinical and medical billing, legal compliance, insurance and patient accounts receivable, claim processing, and appeals. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in these areas and be able to lead a team to achieve organizational objectives.
### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**


#### **Management:**

* Directly reporting to the Chief Insurance Officer on all matters regarding responsibilities listed below
* Overseeing allocated responsibilities amongst team and leading by example, implementing best practices
#### **Credentialing****:**


* Manage the credentialing process for all providers to ensure compliance with insurance requirements and regulations.
* Maintain up-to-date records and documentation for all credentialed providers.
#### **Auditing****:**


* Conduct regular audits of clinical and billing processes to ensure accuracy and compliance with industry standards and legal requirements.
* Implement corrective actions based on audit findings to improve processes and reduce errors.
#### **Clinical and Medical Billing:**


* Oversee the billing process, ensuring timely and accurate submission of claims.
* Work closely with clinical staff to ensure proper documentation and coding for services rendered.

#### **Legal Compliance:**


* Ensure all billing practices comply with state and federal regulations, including HIPAA.
* Stay updated on changes in regulations and implement necessary changes to maintain compliance.
#### **Insurance and Patient Accounts Receivable (AR):**


* Manage insurance AR by monitoring outstanding claims and following up with insurance companies for resolution.
* Oversee patient AR to ensure timely collection of outstanding balances and implement strategies to reduce overdue accounts.
#### **Claim Processing & Appeals:**


* Oversee the processing of insurance claims from submission to payment.
* Handle claim denials and appeals, working to resolve issues and secure appropriate reimbursement.
### **YOUR EXPERIENCE:**


* Minimum of 4+ years of relevant work experience in insurance management within a healthcare or dental setting.
* Strong knowledge of credentialing, dental billing, and insurance AR processes.
* Experience in auditing clinical and billing practices for compliance and accuracy.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Proven ability to build rapport with colleagues and train staff.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
### **OUR EMPLOYEE BENEFITS!** (Full-Time)


* **Flexible Health and Vision Insurance Plans**: Tailored options for you and your family's well-being.
* **401(K) Retirement Plan with Matching:** Secure your financial future with our employer-matched plan up to 6%.
* **Generous Paid-Time Off:** Accrue up to 3 weeks, plus an annual "you" day for self-care.
* **Exclusive In-house Dental Program**: Heavily discounted services for you and your immediate family.
* **Extra Perks and Fringe Benefits:** Enjoy additional benefits and ongoing perks for our dedicated teams.
* Incredible work environment of skilled individuals with the opportunity for massive growth!

*NY Salary Range $90,000 - $110,000*

title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)- Somerset, NJ
description:
**REGISTERED BEHAVIOR TECHNICIAN**

Everas Community Services, Inc. has been providing community-based services to people with intellectual and developmental disabilities for more than 40 years. Our extensive experience includes services for people across a spectrum of abilities and specialized needs including people who are deaf-blind, deaf, or blind, people with intensive medical and behavioral support needs, and people with autism spectrum disorder. Through our work to help people thrive and be empowered to contribute to their greatest capacity, we are making a positive difference in the lives of our clients, our employees, and the greater community. Join our team of professional staff committed to providing support services with care, quality, and respect throughout nine counties in NJ.

Summary We are seeking a dedicated Registered Behavior Technician to join our team at Everas. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in providing individualized support to people with developmental disabilities, focusing on implementing behavioral and habilitation plans. Responsibilities include collaboration with Everas team members on staff in-service development, conducting one-on-one therapy utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), and maintaining accurate documentation. The Behavioral Support Specialist will also facilitate training for Direct Support Professionals (DSPs), advocate for client needs, and ensure compliance with Everas policies and procedures. This position requires advanced communication skills, a commitment to client advocacy, and the ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team. If you are passionate about making a positive impact and promoting the well-being of individuals with disabilities, we encourage you to apply.

**Behavior Technician duties include but are not limited to**:

* Acts as an advocate for client needs; research and coordinate behavioral support services
* Visits all clients as assigned to provide direct one on one therapy using Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
* Demonstrate ABA techniques to teach client new skills, including NET, DTT and Modeling.
* Help prepare clients individualized daily schedules
* Implement training and therapy sessions designed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
* Assess and document individual client’s behavior and progress on implemented plans and protocols
* Support instruction of DSP staff on the implementation of behavior observation systems, training/support plans and behavior intervention guidelines
* Prepare and complete all necessary documentation of assessments and therapies in clients EHR
* Research and secure all necessary and appropriate behavior support services and adaptive equipment as instructed by supervisor

**What We Offer:**

* Rewarding work that provides skills development leading to career advancement
* Interdisciplinary teamwork and experience in a professional yet familial work setting
* Paid training
* Paid time off
* Medical Insurance Plan
* Retirement Plan
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Referral Incentive Program
* Flexible Schedule

**Job Requirements:**

* High School diploma
* RBT certification
* Ability to exercise independent judgement
* Valid NJ Driver’s License
* Required to achieve certification in and perform CPR and CMT
* Experience with intellectual and developmental disabilities preferred

Job Type:

Full Time/ Some evenings and weekends

Job Type: Full-time

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

* RBT Certification (Required)
* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Somerset, NJ (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 75% (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
company_addresses:
Everas Community Services, Inc.

24K World’s Fair Drive
Somerset, NJ 08873

title: Ab Initio Lead Developer
description:
**Infosys is seeking an Ab Initio Lead Developer****:** Participate and contribute to the requirements elicitation process and create requirements documentation. Participate in creating application architecture document to provide deliverables in line with architectural requirements. Deliver high quality code deliverables and support peers in quality checks such that design requirements are met. Create user documentation for the assigned modules. Lead validation activities for the assigned modules for all types of testing e.g., Functional, Integration, System, User Experience etc. Support the creation of “Go Live” plan and manage assigned activities in the plan. Perform root-cause analysis of any issues that arise post-implementation and work on appropriate solutions.  

**Required Qualifications:**

* Candidates must be located within commuting distance of **Jersey City, NJ** or must be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel within the US.
* Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
* Candidates authorized to work for any employer in the United States without employer-based visa sponsorship are welcome to apply. Infosys is unable to provide immigration sponsorship for this role at this time.
* At least 4 years of Information Technology experience.
* At Least 3 years of Hands on experience in Ab Initio ETL
* Good experience in end-to-end implementation of data warehouse and data marts
* Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in Oracle/Teradata, SQL, Unix shell scripting
* Strong communication and Analytical skills

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Good understanding of data integration, data quality and data architecture
* Experience in Relational Modeling, Dimensional Modeling and Modeling of Unstructured Data
* Good understanding of Agile software development frameworks
* Experience in Banking domain
* Ability to work in teams in a diverse, multi-stakeholder environment comprising of Business and Technology teams.
* Experience and desire to work in a global delivery environment.


The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.

  

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  

  

**Infosys provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race; color; sex; gender identity; sexual orientation; religious practices and observances; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; status as a protected veteran or spouse/family member of a protected veteran; or disability.**

title: Construction Site Superintendent
description:
**Job Summary**:

**Mercer County NJ Construction and Development Company** is looking for a full time **Construction Superintendent** to be part of its Construction team. The Construction Superintendent is responsible for the planning, coordination and supervision of all activities of the project. Must be well organized and have the ability to lead and motivate subcontractors, plan well and execute professionally. Ensure job safety and effectively communicate and troubleshoot when issues arise in a timely manner.

**Essential Functions**

* Safely manage the project on-site to produce quality workmanship, on time, within budget and schedule, on a daily basis
* Ensures a safe work site and clean, organized project site
* Ensures all company policies and procedures and standards are enforced on the project
* Exhibits strong problem-solving ability
* Must be able to communicate effectively
* Must be self-motivated
* Builds and maintains good working relationships with TWP inspectors, subcontractors and owner rep
* Schedule all inspections
* Understand and maintains most current contract documents and scopes that are used to build the project
* Maintain an as-built set of drawings on site
* Ensures installations are consistent with contract documents
* Has knowledge and understanding of the scope of work to construct the project
* Plans and supervises all other employees/laborer activities
* Coordinate and plans activities of all contractors
* Collaborates effectively with the Sr. Project manager on schedules, cost control and materials and other resources
* Assumes responsibility for all project safety and safety meetings, will be responsible for completing incident reports and job safety assessments
* Schedules and stages deliveries of materials and products purchased
* Review invoices for completeness of work approved
* Ground up construction knowledge
* Should have 3 to 10 years of experience in multifamily project construction and perform physical duties in the work environment

**Job Qualifications**:

* 3+ years of Job Superintendent experience in commercial construction with management and oversight experience over multiple trade disciplines
* 3+ years’ experience in commercial construction or construction management with ground up and fit out projects
* The ability to ready and interpret drawings/blueprints
* Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills as well as have a high attention to detail

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have 3-10 years of experience as a job site superintendent?
* Do you have 3+ years of experience in commercial construction or construction management?
* Do you have experience with ground-up and fit-out construction projects?

Work Location: In person

title: School Business Administrator/Board Secretary
description:
**SCHOOL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATOR/BOARD SECRETARY**

**TEANECK PUBLIC SCHOOLS**  
Teaneck Public Schools, a unique and diverse school district, is seeking a School Business Administrator/Board Secretary to oversee the day-to-day operations of our Business Office. This includes financial operations (purchasing, budgeting, etc.), custodial services, food services, and transportation. The successful candidate will also serve as the Secretary of the Board. Located in Teaneck, NJ, a vibrant suburban community just five miles from NYC, our preK-12 school district boasts a student population of 4,300 and a school budget exceeding $97 million.

The role of School Business Administrator / Board Secretary is a crucial one, demanding high-level Business Administration skills with proven experience in Public School Administration. Proficiency in all aspects of managing the business office, including budget development, financial reporting, purchasing, contract negotiations, insurance, transportation, and food service, is essential to our operations.

***Qualifications:***

* NJ School Business Administrator Certification is required.
* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* A Qualified Purchasing Agent (QPA) certificate is highly preferred.
* Experience with New Jersey Public School business office processes.
* Minimum of five years of experience in an accounting related field with expertise in school finance either as a school employee or a school auditor.
* Comprehensive knowledge and experience in school budgetary control and financial reporting and accounting procedures consistent with statute, code, and GAAP requirements.
* Experience and competency in using electronic payroll systems, New Jersey and federal data systems, and data processing applications, including but not limited to Excel, Google Sheets, etc.
* Ability to demonstrate competence in managing the business functions of a comprehensive New Jersey K-12 School District.
* Knowledge of statutory requirements and accepted practices in school districts related to budget preparation, business operations, insurance, purchasing, transportation, food services, school plant operations, facility planning, school construction, school development, grants, public school employment and collective bargaining.
* Ability to read, write and clearly communicate with staff.
* Ability to think critically and problem-solve, set goals, and work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to collaborate and work diligently with school district leadership and staff.
* Demonstrated leadership qualities and abilities.
* Must pass a criminal history background check and provide proof of US citizenship or resident alien status.
* Comprehensive understanding of the duties of the Board Secretary pursuant to N.J.S.A. 18A:17-5et.seq.
* A Minimum of five (5) years of successful experience as a School Business Administrator / Board Secretary is highly preferred.
* Other duties as assigned by the Superintendent of Schools.
* ***Note:***This is an exempt position. Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

Please visit our website at teaneckschools.org and apply via Frontline Applitrack

Teaneck Public Schools is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $185,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required)
* School experience: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Teaneck, NJ 07666 (Required)

Silverseal is a fast-growing security and investigation company seeking to hire dedicated, professional, motivated, and customer service orientated Corporate Security Officers to work in one of our Brooklyn, New York locations. This position will be a short-term temporary assignment.

title: Sports Card Breaker/Live Streamer
description:
**Job description**

**Job Company Overview:**

Skybox Collectibles is one of the largest trading card stores in New England with a retail location and a growing online presence. Our goal is to provide high quality products and services at fair retail prices. Skybox Collectibles is in position to become an industry leader in the trading card business.

Skybox Breaks is a growing brand in the online breaking community and an important branch of the Skybox Collectibles company. Our goal is to build a team of streamers and breakers who will work together to provide the same quality experience online, while driving sales and customer engagement.

**Responsibilities Include:**

* Engage with online customers via livestream to create in-the-moment and repeat buyers specifically by showcasing Sports Cards (required) and other various TCGs / collectibles (preferred)
* Ability to bring energy, passion, and knowledge of sports into the daily streams
* Showcase, protect, and ship valuable sports product professionally and efficiently
* Maintain and communicate both pre- and post-stream tasks including but not limited to: creating schedules, sales reports, inventory management, shipping logistics.
* Collaborate with in-house marketing team to grow the live audience while strengthening the company’s overall brand
* Collaborate with our in house fulfillment and customer service team to ensure livestream orders are shipped efficiently, which can involve packaging orders and carrying large boxes
* Seek, receive, and provide feedback with colleagues to promote growth in all roles
* Marketing breaks/online listings as well as seeking out more customers
* Research players, sports, releases, checklists, breaker market and costs so we can make profitable decisions as well as inform customers the best we can

**Requirements:**

* A knowledge of sports, sports current events, and sports cards - while eager to continue learning about the collectibles hobby
* Proven track record of live streaming (preferred)
* Strong presentation skills with the ability to show constant authenticity and entertainment
* Comfort with being camera-facing for an online live audience ranging from 50-150 people
* Strong ability to adapt in the moment during a constantly changing environment
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
